content:
(b) If magnetic monopoles existed, how would the Gauss's law of magnetism be modified?

(c) Does a bar magnet exert a torque on itself due to its own field? Does one element of a current-carrying wire exert a force on another element of the same wire?

(d) Magnetic field arises due to charges in motion. Can a system have magnetic moments even though its net charge is zero?
summary: The text discusses the implications of magnetic monopoles on Gauss's law of magnetism, the torque on a bar magnet, magnetic moments in systems with zero net charge, and the interaction between elements of a current-carrying wire.
hypothetical_questions: What would be the impact on magnetic fields and forces if magnetic monopoles existed?
Would one element of a current-carrying wire exert a force on another element of the same wire?
